page.title: 03OXSHOTT RAILWAY STATION
page.content: The{Oxshott Railway Station}was built in 1885 on the Guildford to Waterloo line. It is built in red brick. There are two tracks each of which have three rails, two for the wheels and one carrying electricity. A foot bridge connects the two platforms. The trains are very modern with sliding doors. There are usually 2 trains each hour in each direction with more during the rush hours. The station is about to be decorated. The busiest time in the station is from 7.30 to 9.00 and again in the evening. It costs Â£1.90 to travel to London and after 9.30 a Day Return costs Â£2.00. A yearly season ticket costs about Â£800.00.The trains are usually on time but they are occasionally late. There is a car park at the station at 40p a day. There is also a level crossing nearby.
